Sphinx Demo

Documenting Python Code¶

At this point you would normaly have your python project with multiple .py files that contain various classes and functions. Here you could let Sphinx create .rst files automatically based on your project by running:

sphinx-apidoc -o source/ ../sphinx_apidoc

sphinx-apidoc is a tool for automatic generation of Sphinx sources that, using the autodoc extension, document a whole package in the style of other automatic API documentation tools.

The usage is as follows:

sphinx-apidoc [OPTIONS] -o <OUTPUT_PATH> <MODULE_PATH> [EXCLUDE_PATTERN …]

MODULE_PATH is the path to a Python package to document, and OUTPUT_PATH is the directory where the generated sources are placed. Any EXCLUDE_PATTERNs given are fnmatch-style file and/or directory patterns that will be excluded from generation.

For the purpose of simple demonstration we will skip this automatic generation and create some .py files that we want to document manualy.

Following the structure of our project in /sphinx-demo directory run:

mkdir demo_code

Here create files:

touch demo_functions.py
touch demo_classes.py

Documenting in Docstrings¶

To document your code use docstrings. Since Sphinx’s native language is reStructuredText, it is recomended to write in reST style:

"""
:param x: Input value
:return: Output value
"""

You can also write in Google-style docstrings:

"""
Args:
x (int): Input value


Returns:
int: Output value
"""

Or Num-Py style docstrings:

"""
Parameters
----------
x : int


Returns
-------
int
"""

Note

Since we added napoleon extention, it allows Google & NumPy styles!

Docstrings in Functions Example¶

def add(a: int, b: int) -> int:
    """
    Add two integers.

    :param a: First number
    :param b: Second number
    :return: Sum of both numbers
    """
    return a + b

Automatic Documentation of the Functions¶

By adding this code block to your .rst file:

.. autofunction:: demo_code.demo_functions.add

.. autofunction:: demo_code.demo_functions.divide

This part of the documentation is created automatically:

demo_code.demo_functions.add(a: int, b: int) → int[source]¶

Add two integers.

Parameters:

  • a – First number

  • b – Second number

Returns:

Sum of a and b

demo_code.demo_functions.divide(a: float, b: float) → float[source]¶

Divide two numbers.

Raises:

ZeroDivisionError – If b is zero

Hint

We can add another function documentation from a different path

.. autofunction:: main.main
main.main()[source]¶

Main function for Sphinx Demo.

Automatic Documentation of the Classes¶

This part of the documentation was also created automatically.

In the .rst file this block was added for Sphinx to pull docstrings from from demo_classes.py file and build the documentation.

.. autoclass:: demo_code.demo_classes.DemoClass
    :members:
    :no-index:
class demo_code.demo_classes.DemoClass(initial_demo_number: float = 0.0)[source]

A simple class for demo purposes.

Parameters:

initial_demo_number (float) – A description of the initial demo number that is passed on class initialization.

demo_number

A description of the class attribute that represents the demo number.

Type:

float

add(amount: float)[source]

Increases the demo number by specified amount.

Parameters:

amount (float) – Amount to add.

Returns:

None

get_demo_number() → float[source]

Returns the current demo number.

Returns:

Current demo number.

Return type:

float

subtract(amount: float)[source]

Subtracts the specified amount from the demo number.

Parameters:

amount (float) – Amount to subtract.

Returns:

None

Raises:

InsufficientNumberError – If the demo number is insufficient.

Automatic Documentation of a Module¶

You can document whole module by adding this in the .rst file:

.. automodule:: demo_code.demo_classes
    :members:
    :member-order: bysource
    :undoc-members:
    :show-inheritance:
exception demo_code.demo_classes.InsufficientNumberError(demo_number: float, amount: float)[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Exception raised when attempting to subtract more than available.

Parameters:

  • demo_number (float) – Current demo number.

  • amount (float) – Attempted subtraction amount.

demo_number¶

Current balance.

Type:

float

amount¶

Attempted amount of subtraction.

Type:

float

class demo_code.demo_classes.DemoClass(initial_demo_number: float = 0.0)[source]¶

Bases: object

A simple class for demo purposes.

Parameters:

initial_demo_number (float) – A description of the initial demo number that is passed on class initialization.

demo_number¶

A description of the class attribute that represents the demo number.

Type:

float

add(amount: float)[source]¶

Increases the demo number by specified amount.

Parameters:

amount (float) – Amount to add.

Returns:

None

subtract(amount: float)[source]¶

Subtracts the specified amount from the demo number.

Parameters:

amount (float) – Amount to subtract.

Returns:

None

Raises:

InsufficientNumberError – If the demo number is insufficient.

get_demo_number() → float[source]¶

Returns the current demo number.

Returns:

Current demo number.

Return type:

float

Note

We used :no-index: when we added a class with autoclass. This is due to how Sphinx is indexing the documentation. It affects search, sidebar and other ways to link to this specific description of the object
